name: 01-Project Overview
content:
SUPPLY-CHAIN-OTIF-ANALYSIS


Objective

The On-Time In-Full (OTIF) Analysis project evaluates how effectively companies deliver customer orders by measuring both timeliness and completeness. OTIF serves as a critical supply chain performance metric, ensuring deliveries meet promised schedules and include the correct items and quantities. A high OTIF score indicates operational excellence and customer satisfaction, while a low score highlights issues such as late shipments or incomplete orders that can negatively impact business outcomes.


Approach

  1. Data Preparation
  • Define the dataset and establish key OTIF measurement criteria.
  • Calculate time differences between critical stages (e.g., Purchase Order receipt, Material Dispatch, Material Arrival).
  • Extract relevant date and time components (e.g., lead times, delays, seasonality).

2.Exploratory Data Analysis (EDA)

  • Perform statistical and visual analysis to uncover patterns in OTIF performance.
  • Identify common causes of delays, incomplete orders, and supply chain inefficiencies.

3.Machine Learning (ML) Model Development

  • Train predictive models to forecast delivery performance.
  • Use feature importance analysis to identify key drivers influencing OTIF deviations.
  • Generate recommendations to improve delivery consistency and efficiency.


Significance

  • Customer Satisfaction: Consistently meeting promised delivery timelines improves customer trust, loyalty, and repeat business.
  • Brand Reputation: Reliable, timely deliveries strengthen the companyâ€™s position as a dependable and customer-focused supplier.
  • Inventory Management: Accurate OTIF performance reduces excess inventory, prevents stockouts, and optimizes working capital.
  • Supplier Relationships: Achieving OTIF goals requires close supplier collaboration, leading to more reliable procurement and production cycles.
  • Data-Driven Insights: Monitoring OTIF metrics provides actionable intelligence to guide continuous improvement initiatives.


Expected Outcomes

  • Accurate predictions of delivery timelines for inbound and outbound materials.
  • Identification of key factors (supplier delays, production bottlenecks, transportation issues) influencing OTIF performance.
  • Optimization recommendations to improve supply chain reliability, reduce costs, and enhance OTIF scores.
